title: Jacky Cupit
text:
Jacky Douglas Cupit (born February 1, 1938) is an American <a href="professional%20golfer">professional golfer</a> who has played on both the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a> and the <a href="Senior%20PGA%20Tour">Senior PGA Tour</a> (now known as the <a href="Champions%20Tour">Champions Tour</a>).
Born and raised in <a href="Longview%2C%20Texas">Longview</a> in the <a href="piney%20woods">piney woods</a> of <a href="east%20Texas">east Texas</a>, Cupit attended the <a href="University%20of%20Houston">University of Houston</a>. As a member of the <a href="Houston%20Cougars">Cougars</a> <a href="golf">golf</a> team, he earned <a href="All-American">All-American</a> honors in 1959 and 1960, turned pro in 1960, and joined the <a href="PGA%20Tour">PGA Tour</a> in 1961. His older brother, <a href="Buster%20Cupit">Buster</a>, was a professional golfer who played mainly in Texas and Oklahoma.
Cupit played on the PGA Tour from 1961 to 1973 and had four victories. His first came at the <a href="Canadian%20Open%20%28golf%29">Canadian Open</a> in <a href="1961%20PGA%20Tour">1961</a>, helping him to win the PGA's "Rookie of the Year" award. His last tour win came in <a href="1966%20PGA%20Tour">1966</a> at the Cajun Classic. Cupit's best finish in a <a href="Men%27s%20major%20golf%20championships">major</a> was runner-up at the <a href="U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">U.S. Open</a> in <a href="1963%20U.S.%20Open%20%28golf%29">1963</a>, when he and <a href="Arnold%20Palmer">Arnold Palmer</a> lost to <a href="Julius%20Boros">Julius Boros</a> in a three-way playoff.
After reaching the age of 50 in 1988, Cupit played part-time on the <a href="Senior%20PGA%20Tour">Senior PGA Tour</a>. He currently is the Golf Professional Emeritus at the Links at Land's End in <a href="Yantis%2C%20Texas">Yantis</a>, Texas.
Professional wins (4).
PGA Tour wins (4).
PGA Tour playoff record (1–2)
Results in major championships.
"Note: Cupit never played in <a href="The%20Open%20Championship">The Open Championship</a>."<br>
